definitions.definition: A type of twilled woollen cloth, often with a tartan or chequered pattern.

A length of such material used as a piece of clothing, formerly worn in the Scottish Highlands and other parts of northern Britain and remaining as an item of ceremonial dress worn by members of Scottish pipe bands.
The typical chequered pattern of a plaid; tartan .

main_definition: ( textiles ) A type of twilled woollen cloth, often with a tartan or chequered pattern. [from 16 c.]
secondary_definitions: A length of such material used as a piece of clothing, formerly worn in the Scottish Highlands and other parts of northern Britain and remaining as an item of ceremonial dress worn by members of Scottish pipe bands. [from 16 c.]
The typical chequered pattern of a plaid; tartan . [from 19 c.]
